vulnerabilityLikelihoodImpact.vulnerability: In production or integration supply chain (i.e. use of faulty component)
Reset switch leading to insecure state
No authenticity check on all updates
No integrity check on all updates
No control of sensor environment (e.g. can blind a camera- or put a heat source in front of a temperature sensor)
Unnecessary or unused services and applications
Lack of message integrity check (nonce- MACs- etc.)
No redundancy of storage or service
Cloud interface does not support two-factor authentication
Existence of a kill command that permanently disables device
No lock-out or delaying measures to protect accounts against brute-force attacks
Some security features are left unenabled
No mutual authentication between client and server
Easy discovery of IoT devices on LAN
Administration interface contains common web application/management console vulnerabilities
Security audit vulnerabilities - security audit functions miss
No physical security (i.e. physical barriers- locks or access controls)
Application does not use SSL connection to cloud
No enforcement or possibility of strong password
Unauthenticated requests to perform actions (ex. reconon- data retrieval- management functions- etc.) gurati
Cloud platform contains common web application/management console vulnerabilities
No lock-out or delaying measures to protect accounts against brute-force attacks
Identification options and HTTP trace methods are enabled
Ability to perform unrequested rmware upgrades
Data is identifiable and not anonymized
No session identifiers (session tokens- OTP- etc.)

controlSensitivities.control: Ensure updates can be verified -  downloaded securely and applied quickly when vulnerabilities are discovered
Schedule and implement periodic updates
The access control privileges are defined -  justified and documented.
Conduct periodic web application penetration testing assessments for web interfaces and ensure a web application penetration testing assessment test has been conducted before deployment
Ensure redundancy is available in case of IoT devices being unavailable.
Manage changes with suppliers
Identify and address risks while dealing with third parties through agreements
Monitor and review supplier services
All the applicable security features supported by the OS are enabled.r
Delete unnecessary applications on IoT devices
Delete unused services on IoT devices
Ensure web application firewall is enabled where available
Ensure web application firewall is enabled where available

Where a product includes a trusted secure boot process -  the entire production test and any related calibration is executed with the processor system operating in its secured boot -  authenticated software mode.
Ensure HTTPS is enabled
A vulnerability assessment has been performed before deployment and on an ongoing basis afterwards.
Perform application whitelisting
Maintain devices to ensure integrity and availability
Change the default password to a strong one and if possible change the default username as well
Ensure all collected personal data is properly protected using encryption at rest and in transit
Monitor the network continuously
Conduct periodic network penetration testing assessments or red team exercises
Perform security architecture and design exercise to identify security services to be installed and install identified security services.
Enable account lockout functionality where available
Enable physical protection against tampering and reverse engineering
Ensure two factor authentication is enabled where available
There is a process for secure provisioning of keys that includes generation -  distribution -  revocation and destruction. For example in compliance with FIPS140-2 [ref 5] or similar process.
Ensure SSL/TLS implementations are up to date and properly configured
Enable making a periodic change of passwords mandatory (for example the duration could be 90 days)
Check to ensure that any sensitive data and licensed software has been removed or securely overwritten prior to disposal.
Ensure all devices do not make network ports and/or services available to the internet
Ensure all devices operate with a minimal number of network ports active
Disable any unused physical ports
All communications port(s) -  such as USB -  RS232 etc. -  which are not used as part of the product_ normal operation are not physically accessible or are disabled.
Ensure all communication between system components is encrypted as well as encrypting traffic between the system or device and the internet
Apply physical protection measures against environmental threats
Apply physical access controls to prevent unauthorized access to IoT devices
Apply jamming countermeasures
Passwords file(s) are owned by and are only accessible to and writable by the most privileged account.
The production software signing keys are under access control.r
Mandate permission prior to taking devices off-site or moving devices between locations
The product only allows controlled user account access; access using anonymous or guest user accounts are not supported without justification.
Limit administrative capabilities
All the related and network elements servers prevent anonymous/guest access except for read only access to public information.
Access granted to employees is periodically reviewed.
Files and directories are set to appropriate access privileges on a need to access basis.
Set user privileges to the minimal needed for operation
In the event that the product is intended to allow un-authenticated software -  such software should only be run with limited permissions and/or sandbox.r
Enable a firewall and ensure that it can only be accessed from your client systems
Enable a firewall and ensure that it can only be accessed from your client systems
Enable any alert and notification functionality for security-related events
Enable any logging functionality for security-related events
Protect log information from tampering
Enable network segmentation technologies such as firewalls to isolate IoT systems from critical IT systems
All interactive operating system accounts or logins have been disabled.
For products with multiple network interfaces -  the uncontrolled ability to forward IP packets between the interfaces is disabled.r
Ensure that asset owners are informed about what data is collected -  why -  where it will be stored.
Retain data for only as long as necessary.
Ensure business continuity disaster recovery plans exist and are tested regularly.
Ensure periodic internal audits are conducted.
Use data only with prior permission of all interested parties.
Collect data only if it has business-use or is essential to the functioning of the IoT device
Ensure compliance with relevant laws and regulations.

There are documented information security policies and procedures based on accepted standards -  guidelines -  and other documentation. Required policies for IoT include policies on asset management -  access control -  physical security -  communications security -  systems security -  incident management -  business continuity and compliance. Required procedures for IoT include procedures on patch management -  exception management -  change management -  incident managment -  access control managment (user activation/deactivation and privilege management).
Organization of information security (roles and responsibilities to ensure information security) is defined for the consumer.
Ensure asset owners check/verify what data is collected and delete data if necessary.r
There is a secure notification process based upon the IoTSF _ Vulnerability Disclosure Guidelines_ or similar recognised process -  for notifying partners/ users of any security updates.
Ensure periodic third-party audits are conducted.
A policy has been established for dealing with both internal and third party security research on the products or services.

Whenever there is collection of data -  a privacy and acceptance notice must be acknowledged by the entity prior to providing the data. This notice must state the company's policy on data collection -  usage -  and retention.

A process is in place for consistent briefing of senior executives in the event of the identification of a vulnerability or a security breach -  especially those who may deal with the media or make public announcements. In particular that any public statementsmade in the event of a security breach -  should give as full and accurate account of the facts as possible.
There is a role -  typically a board level executive -  who takes ownership of and is responsible for product -  service and business level security.

data.control: Collect data only if it has business-use or is essential to the functioning of the IoT device
Use data only with prior permission of all interested parties.

There is a role -  typically a board level executive -  who takes ownership of and is responsible for product -  service and business level security.
Organization of information security (roles and responsibilities to ensure information security) is defined for the consumer.

There are documented information security policies and procedures based on accepted standards -  guidelines -  and other documentation. Required policies for IoT include policies on asset management -  access control -  physical security -  communications security -  systems security -  incident management -  business continuity and compliance. Required procedures for IoT include procedures on patch management -  exception management -  change management -  incident managment -  access control managment (user activation/deactivation and privilege management).
A policy has been established for dealing with both internal and third party security research on the products or services.

A process is in place for consistent briefing of senior executives in the event of the identification of a vulnerability or a security breach -  especially those who may deal with the media or make public announcements. In particular that any public statementsmade in the event of a security breach -  should give as full and accurate account of the facts as possible.

Ensure that asset owners are informed about what data is collected -  why -  where it will be stored.
Ensure asset owners check/verify what data is collected and delete data if necessary.r

Whenever there is collection of data -  a privacy and acceptance notice must be acknowledged by the entity prior to providing the data. This notice must state the company's policy on data collection -  usage -  and retention.
